Articles.Content: Also, @linuxgurugamer , can you look at that PR and possibly merge it officially?

New release, 0.44.0

  • Thanks to github user @josuenos for this:
    • Add in option to set PWing Wing part to non-lifting in Stock Aero. Adds toggle to the Part UI, toggling between:  
      • Surface Config: Lifting" and "Surface Config: Not Lifting"
    • Allows for use of PWings to make interesting geometries without the impact of bad lift vectors (i.e. F-117 replica).

Question:

I had the mod working perfectly. 

Then I decided to install FAR.

Then I uninstalled it a few days later. After this, the B9 PWing mod UI doesn't appear. The parts are still accessable, but hovering over the parts and pressing J and all doesn't work. At all. I'm not sure what to do. I'll link my KSP.log and Player.log

thx

 

I'm running the latest version of the mod


Also, if I load a vessel in the editor that used the pwings, it loads them properly, but when I launch the craft, the craft spawns with the procedural wings "sizes" reset to default

https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1ScJJ5o-HaT3sraBW1zuOdBsWb1FozcSt?usp=sharing

Edited February 21, 2023 by BaxterCash

On 7/5/2021 at 3:44 PM, linuxgurugamer said:

The procedural dynamics procedural wing (pWing for short) is a wing piece that the user can procedurally manipulate, the wing automatically generates colliders and set its .cfg parameters accordingly.

@linuxgurugamer

can you tell ab bit more about how it works: 

Does the mod create cfg-files for every edited wing and store them? Or are the parts only templates and the length/width...values are only stored in the craft file?  Can I re-use already set up wings on other crafts (or domthey have to be transplanted via subassemblies?)

*Solved*

Edited March 1, 2023 by Voculus

On 2/28/2023 at 12:31 PM, Rakete said:

@linuxgurugamer

can you tell ab bit more about how it works: 

Does the mod create cfg-files for every edited wing and store them? Or are the parts only templates and the length/width...values are only stored in the craft file?  Can I re-use already set up wings on other crafts (or domthey have to be transplanted via subassemblies?)

Guess, I'll have to find it out myself...

So for some reason this mod breaks Tweakscale. When starting the game with both this mod and Tweakscale, an error message from Tweakscale says it's missing a certain DLL file. However, when deleting the "B9_Aerospace_ProceduralWings" folder from GameData, it starts up without any problems. Anyone know what could cause this problem?

Hi there. Not sure if this is known, but it seems that B9 parts generates no value (fund) when recovered?

Just tested with a clean game (with Breaking Ground if that matters) with only B9 Procedural WIngs and B9 Part Switch, and I cannot recover fund from B9 parts.

Steps to reproduce:

  1. Start a career game.
  2. Make a plane with B9 parts, and note down the cost before launching
  3. Launch the craft and immediately recover it.
  4. The fund from recovery should be much less than the number listed in editor, even though the UI says 100% value recovered. B9 parts are not listed in the recovery list and seems lost.

On 3/4/2023 at 10:48 AM, LeviOz said:

So for some reason this mod breaks Tweakscale. When starting the game with both this mod and Tweakscale, an error message from Tweakscale says it's missing a certain DLL file. However, when deleting the "B9_Aerospace_ProceduralWings" folder from GameData, it starts up without any problems. Anyone know what could cause this problem?

 

Looks like @Lisias might want to hear about this.

On 3/4/2023 at 10:48 AM, LeviOz said:

So for some reason this mod breaks Tweakscale. When starting the game with both this mod and Tweakscale, an error message from Tweakscale says it's missing a certain DLL file. However, when deleting the "B9_Aerospace_ProceduralWings" folder from GameData, it starts up without any problems. Anyone know what could cause this problem?

B9 Procedural Wings is badly installed, you forgot to install a dependence. This triggers a nasty bug inside KSP on a thingy called Assembly Loader/Resolver that, once triggered, screws everything and everybody that tries to load something, being TweakScale one of them.

Post your KSP.log here and @linuxgurugamerwill gladly check it and tell you what's missing.

On 3/19/2023 at 12:50 PM, Lisias said:

B9 Procedural Wings is badly installed, you forgot to install a dependence. This triggers a nasty bug inside KSP on a thingy called Assembly Loader/Resolver that, once triggered, screws everything and everybody that tries to load something, being TweakScale one of them.

Post your KSP.log here and @linuxgurugamerwill gladly check it and tell you what's missing.

@LeviOz

How did you install it?  Please provide a log file

Hello,

Is there a way to attach parts to the all moving wing, and have them moving with it ?

Thanks for your help

The localization files of the mod is still unfinished,and I remember there is localization in former edition,any plans to complete it?

Thanks for your help.

i made an f22 that uses the structural wings for most of the fuselage and wings that keeps crashing when i pull it out into the airfield
i have no clue what is causing it
is there a common crash fix of some sort that im missing or is it just bugged

Edited May 3, 2023 by DatBoi6713
more detail

i think i fixed the issue:
if you put too many individual wings on a craft it has a tendency to crash when you launch the craft

for newer parts I'm able to recolor the entire part but parts on older crafts I am only able to recolor the main part and leading edge, any fix?

Is there a guide (preferably video) or wiki on how to use these parts correctly? I've been fiddling around with them for about 3 hours now trying to make an aircraft and, while I feel like I'm making progress, it also feels like I'm beating my head against a wall trying to make things work because I don't really know what I'm doing. I've spent some time searching through this thread and online for some sort of guide and come up with nothing, so I'm hoping that my google-fu is just failing me and there is some sort of guide or reference that I'm just not finding.

EDIT: To clarify, I get how to manipulate the various parts to make shapes, but am having trouble with details like getting control surfaces to fit properly with the wings etc.

EDIT: Nevermind, have since brute forced my way through figuring it out.
